thread.title: Allegri jokes 'How's my English?' as speculation mounts | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Allegri jokes 'How's my English?' as speculation mounts | Daily Mail Online

author: Ben Nagle For Mailonline
title: Allegri jokes 'How's my English?' as speculation mounts | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The Juventus boss has been successful since him arrival in Serie A, winning the league with both AC Milan and then Juventus. He has also won two Italian Cups in his current role, and took his side to the final of the Champions League two seasons ago. Allegri joked about his grasp of the English language after Juventus' victory on Friday night Paulo Dybala scored twice as Juventus ran out comfortable 4-1 winners at Juventus Stadium This term, Juve are 10 points clear at the top - albeit having played a game more - and Allegri says he is unlikely to change his formation before a midweek Champions League clash with Porto. 'It's unlikely we'll change, unless something strange happens,' he admitted. 'Porto don't concede many goals and they play on the counter-attack. 'Against Sporting they conceded possession to their opponents, leaving no points of reference. Porto are used to these games, it will be a good last 16 tie.' Dybala's left-footed free-kick found the top right corner as he doubled his side's lead Juventus' 4-1 victory extended their lead at the top of Serie A to 10 points on Friday evening Share or comment on this article Most watched Sport videos
